column5: Added missing error handling when cleaning temporary resources (fixes #266)

[Snyk] Upgrade vulnerable dependencies (#265)

The following vulnerabilities are fixed with an upgrade:
- https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-ELECTRON-174045
- https://snyk.io/vuln/SNYK-JS-JQUERY-174006
- https://snyk.io/vuln/npm:braces:20180219
- https://snyk.io/vuln/npm:hoek:20180212
- https://snyk.io/vuln/npm:is-url:20180319
- https://snyk.io/vuln/npm:tunnel-agent:20170305

Upgrade is-url from 1.2.2 to 1.2.4 (#263)

`is-url 1.2.2` was vulnerable to a ReDoS attack. I upgraded the package to `is-url 1.2.4` to address the issue.

You can read more about the [vulnerability on Snyk](https://app.snyk.io/test/npm/is-url/1.2.2).

Added Semicolon to Avoid Semicolon Auto-Insertion (#262)

I added a semicolon to address a [recommendation from lgtm](https://lgtm.com/projects/g/brrd/Abricotine/snapshot/d5ca08ec9a0d2b5a3a1f934ba81bf9992e0062ef/files/app/renderer/export-html.js?sort=name&dir=ASC&mode=heatmap).

Fix autopreview not working when moving cursor

Say goodbye to bower

Since all dependancies are now available on npm, bower is no longer necessary, so 
it is removed and replaced by npm in this commit.

Important note: bower is kept in .gitignore and packager.js ignore fields, otherwise 
it would mess up everything when checking out to an older branch.

So simple-virtual-dom is only called when it is relevant

Use a child_process instead of a web worker

Because worker can not use require()

Use simple-virtual-dom to render #toc-container element

Note:  simple-virtual-dom module has better performances here than virtual-dom.
Fix autopreviewQueue not set in some situations

Autopreview: only process lines when rendered

In order to improve performances, process a line only when it is rendered by 
CodeMirror (rather than the whole document each time a line is rendered). 
`autopreviewQueue` is introduced in order to keep a track of such lines. 
Related to #76.

Use workers in abr-pane (good commit)

**This commit is the good version of a duplicate (my mistake).**

See issue #76.

Improve performances when editing big documents by running most of abr-pane functions in a background thread. However DOM operations (jquery) must remain in
the main thread so this may still be improved.

Add npm install & start scripts

* "npm install" now runs "electron-rebuild" and "bower install"
* "npm start" starts Abricotine (use "npm start -- [args]" to pass parameters)

Merge "Format" and "Insert" commands

Merge "Format" and "Insert" commands by creating "format" and "draw" commands which take a parameter.

Remove utils.js and use remote.require()

* Use remote.require() instead of require("../path")
* utils.js functions have been splited in the other files

Renaming things

* "autopreview" for everything that is related to the inline preview in CodeMirror
* "ul", "ol" and "todolist" for lists (instead of "checkbox", "todo", "unordred-list" and "ordred-list")
Fix trying to open argv optionnal parameters as documents on startup
Renderer js sources moved to renderer root dir

Dictionaries management and spelling menu

Addind spellchecker related UI.

Use node-spellchecker

Use atom/node-spellchecker instead of Typo.js. It is loaded as a module and fixes performance issues experienced with Typo.js.

Removed AbrSpellchecker.

NOTE: "electron-rebuild" package is now a devDependency, so:

1) use "./node_modules/.bin/electron ." to run the app (in oder to use the expected "electron-prebuilt" version)
2) every time "npm install" is run, run this : "./node_modules/.bin/electron-rebuild"

More info : https://github.com/atom/electron/blob/master/docs/tutorial/using-native-node-modules.md

AbrSpellchecker

Add AbrSpellchecker to handle the dictionary loading during abrDoc creation and the switching between dictionaries. The main benefit is to allow to switch between dictionaries without reloading everything (see "test" command).

But this improvement brings a new issue: Typo() object instance is too slow to construct and it slows down the whole browser process (even if async). This is obvious when loading FR or DE dictionaries: the UI freezes during more than 10 sec.

We need to separate the dictionaries loading into another process: Webworker or main process. To be continued...

Added a basic spellchecker

English only is supported
Handle errors when writeFile permission denied

Iframe preview improvements

Iframe:

* Security fix: iframe textMarkers are now rendered in a webview
* Added some default allowed domains
* Added option "preview-security" to disable iframe domain-based filter
* Domains and security toogle are now defined as CodeMirror custom options
* Fix domain check function to accept subdomains
* Handling load, error and timeout iframe events
* Autodetect iframe size and keep its aspect ratio when resizing
* CSS improvements with iframe

Others (changes are related to the iframe work):

* cm-init: Now using Promises for extending and loading cm. The module itself returns a promise.
* com-extend-preview: Fixed a bug with typeConfig.createElement return values that used to lead to the creation of useless markers with no replacedWith element.
* config: Added a default user config file that is copied when the app runs for the first time. This is actually a workaround because nconf does not provide a way to overide a full array, so default domains may not be defined as a true default in config.

ESC key functions

* Exit fullscreen
* Clear search
AbrDocument: store and reuse tmp browser preview path
Fix: workaround for multiple CodeMirror dialogs issue

Image import improvements

* Support for https URLs
* Add user notifications
* Fix overwriting images when same filename
* Fix duplicates when the same image was inserted several times in the document
Fix: Refresh editor when math is previewed
Added commands for anchor & code blocks insertion

Fixed math export and preview

* $$$ delimiter is deprecated, $$ is used for both inline and display math
* Switched from marked to kramed in order to preview math
* Adding math preview in default export template (the included MathJax lib is from the CDN)
* Fixed bad cursor position bug when previewing display math
Fixed drag and drop (insert image or open file)

Styles splitted into 'ui' and 'editor'

* Removed uikit.
* Splitted former app.less into 2 LESS files : ui.less and editor.less. Can lead to theme support in future developments.

Fixed a bug in AbrDocument constructor

Bad execution order : abrDoc.cm is called before it is created. It used to work because
of the random due to IPC callback execution queue.

CodeMirror init improvements

* highlightFormatting in markdown
* colorize LateX Math
* better LateX detection (multiplex)
* disable CodeMirror theme CSS class
* addModeClass to clearly identify markdown and code highlighting in CSS

New config management + fix menu bug

* new config management using nconf module,
* config is loaded as an abrWindow property,
* each window has its own separate menu in order to keep menuItems.checked properties across windows ; the app menu association is changed each time a window is focused,
* some improvements in config JSON,
* minor improvements in autopreview extension for CodeMirror,
* most of commands and menu options are now avalaible.

Huge refactoring of Abricotine !

* Program has been splited between renderer process code and main process code.
* New global object AbrApplication which is the main app manager.
* New object AbrWindow. Browser-windows are managed in the main process by abrApplication (this allows multiple windows in Abricotine).
* A new window is created when opening a new document.
* AbrEditor object is deprecated. It was a quite useless wrapper around CodeMirror. From now CodeMirror's modules and improvement are directly added into the CodeMirror object.
* Communication between the two processes is managed with ipcClient and ipcServer modules. Note : despite most of "server-side" operations should be done into the main process, files I/O operations remain into renderer process in order to avoid IPC mess.
* Many other changes and some minor improvements (see the source).

"New document" opens now a new window (and bug)

This commit led to a new bug due to the menu manager. Since the menu is common for the app, each new window created redefines the menu to target itself, so menu is not working correctly in the other windows. To fix this bug we could detect focused windows in each command, but we will still encounter performance issues, so the best solution would be (probably) refactoring the app to manage init and Abricotine in the main process.

Adding imagesImportAll

Adding imagesImportAll to copy all document images in a single folder.
Fixed ToC not updated when empty

Fixed bad cursorSpy behavior

cursorSpy was updated before updateToc (which overwrites full toc content) so it
was lost on editor change

Adding HTML preview commands (experimental)

Experimental commands for previewing HTML snippets inline (on paste event or preview selected paragraph). Could be used in future to preview iframes (youtube, etc). NOTE: In such a case we should add a whitelist for registering allowed domains.
